messages.content: I am again delighted to have been selected as the Labour Parliamentary Candidate for the City of Durham constituency. It has been an honour to represent this wonderful constituency in parliament since 2005 and I hope with your help to continue to do so.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Continue to fight against NHS privatisation, and to secure a properly funded future for our NHS and Social Care services

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Bring jobs and opportunities to Durham
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Bring more good quality jobs and apprenticeships to Durham, and get our city and region back on track
Prevent front line and neighbourhood offices from being cut and to make our communities more secure
Continue to fight against fracking, while increasing investment in renewable energy

Deliver better community facilities such as the upgraded Wharton Park; improve environmental protection; support vital neighbourhood policing and enhance our beautiful and historic city and our villages.

issues.environment: continue to fight against fracking, while increasing investment in renewable energy
issues.health: continue to fight against NHS privatisation, and to secure a properly funded future for our NHS and Social Care services
issues.labourEmployment: bring more good quality jobs and apprenticeships to Durham, and get our city and region back on track
issues.lawCrime: prevent front line and neighbourhood offices from being cut and to make our communities more secure

community.content: invest in our communities: deliver better community facilities such as the upgraded Wharton Park; improve environmental protection; support vital neighbourhood policing and enhance our beautiful and historic city and our villages.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have a track record of delivering for our community. I hold regular advice surgeries and have helped over 40,000 constituents with almost 50,000 issues. If re-elected, I will continue to be an advocate for Durham.

politicalExperience.achievements: Roberta has been effective in getting new affordable housing in Durham, and an extension to our hospital A&E Department. She is also pressing the Government for more funding for our nurseries, schools, colleges and university.

contactInformation.address: The Miners' Hall, Redhills, Flass Street, Durham, DH1 4BD

quotes.text: Since first being elected as Durham’s MP in 2005, I have been the strong voice that Durham needs. Most importantly, I have a track record of delivering for our community. I hold regular advice surgeries and have helped over 40,000 constituents with almost 50,000 issues.

examples: Since first being elected as Durham’s MP in 2005.
I hold regular advice surgeries and have helped over 40,000 constituents with almost 50,000 issues.
Roberta has been effective in getting new affordable housing in Durham, and an extension to our hospital A&E Department.
I have been the strong voice that Durham needs.
I have a track record of delivering for our community.
I have taken action to make things better in Durham.

invest in our communities: deliver better community facilities such as the upgraded Wharton Park; improve environmental protection; support vital neighbourhood policing and enhance our beautiful and historic city and our villages.
bring more good quality jobs and apprenticeships to Durham, and get our city and region back on track
prevent front line and neighbourhood offices from being cut and to make our communities more secure
continue to fight against NHS privatisation, and to secure a properly funded future for our NHS and Social Care services
continue to fight against fracking, while increasing investment in renewable energy

personalStories.story: I hold regular advice surgeries and have helped over 40,000 constituents with almost 50,000 issues.

examples: This election more than ever offers people a clear choice between a Tory Government that will continue to neglect our city and region and underfund our vital public services, or a Labour Government with the positive vision and policies to create a fairer and more equal society.
